meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I heard a loud bark from the neighbor's dog.
meanings.sent2: The bark of the tree was rough and textured.
meanings.sent3: The bark of the tree seemed to whisper secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent4: The bark of the tree stood out like a rugged shield against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the tree felt like ancient armor protecting the forest.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunder barked angrily in the stormy night.
meanings.sent2: The dog barked loudly at the mailman.
meanings.sent3: The old car barked and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks barked in the sky, lighting up the night.
meanings.sent5: The angry sea barked against the rocky shore, sending spray into the air.

meanings.sent1: The little puppy's bark was high-pitched and playful.
meanings.sent2: The bark of the dog echoed through the quiet night.
meanings.sent3: The bark of the dog interrupted the peaceful silence of the park.
meanings.sent4: The bark of the dog was a symphony of warning and welcome.
meanings.sent5: The bark of the dog was a familiar sound in the neighborhood, signaling the approach of visitors.
